title: Marathon Petroleum Up Over 8% After Activist Letter — Data Talk
text:
Marathon Petroleum Corporation (MPC) is currently at $59.98, up $4.50 or 8.11%

-- Would be highest close since April 30, 2019, when it closed at $60.87

-- On pace for largest percent increase since Nov. 21, 2016, when it rose 8.91%

-- Earlier Wednesday, Hedge fund Elliott Management Corp. sent a letter to Marathon's board proposing again that the fuel maker split into three different companies

-- Wells Fargo raised its price target on Marathon to $77.00/share from $75.00/share, Benzinga reported

-- Currently up six of the past seven days

-- Up 21.89% month-to-date; on pace for best month since June 2012, when it rose 24.54%

-- Up 1.64% year-to-date

-- Down 30.57% from its all-time closing high of $86.39 on Oct. 3, 2018

-- Down 29.04% from 52 weeks ago (Sept. 26, 2018), when it closed at $84.53

-- Down 30.57% from its 52 week closing high of $86.39 on Oct. 3, 2018

-- Up 34.4% from its 52 week closing low of $44.63 on Aug. 14, 2019

-- Best performer in the S&P 500 today

All data as of 2:07:15 PM

Source: Dow Jones Market Data, FactSet

(END) Dow Jones Newswires

September 25, 2019 14:31 ET (18:31 GMT)
